captions.text: Back to back in the kitchen with my buddy, Pear Glasses.
-Back with my big beautiful bushy beard.
I stole it from a lumberjack after I beat his [caw] down.
We're throwing a party with arty and farty.
We're gettin' all Bob Ross up in this mother,
makin' a portrait of yours truly
using bacon, bacon, and more bacon.
Now we start off with a big beautiful ball o' pork.
You know it's the cheeses that pleases,
so lay it on thick, Pear Glasses.
That's right! Now hit it with the bacon strips.
And bacon strips. And bacon strips.
And bacon strips! And bacon strips!
Even midgets think big when it comes to bacon.
-Don't believe the height. All the piggies went to market,
even the little one. Time to hit 'em with the Jack.
Sauce in the house! What's shakin', bacon?
Bread that bad boy up and throw it in the deep-fryer.
Hit it with some chicken-fried bacon strips
and bacon strips and bacon strips and--
Turn that bacon gun up to maximum, fool.
You can't skimp when you're a bacon pimp.
Time to float this mother down
a Slip 'n Slide of spicy cheddar cheese.
Hey, Yakety Yak, don't talk back.
Let's get this bad boy bearded up.
Hit him with the bacon bits, Pear Glasses.
We've got a blizzard of bacon beatin' down on the counter.
Whoa! It's a masterpiece of meat,
like a Picasso made of pork. It's almost too beautiful to--
